intro: Dendrobium sarmentosum, commonly known as the creeping dendrobium, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic plant that grows on trees and rocks, often in humid tropical environments. The plant features long, wiry stems that can reach several meters in length, with clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Dendrobium sarmentosum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in a variety of growing conditions.
